nitf::Object

nitf::Object< T, DestructFunctor_T > Class Template Reference

This class keeps a pointer to an underlying C object The Object class does not destroy or clone any memory. The sole purpose is to act as a non-invasive wrapper on top of objects internal to the NITF C core. More...

#include <Object.hpp>

Detailed Description

template<typename T, typename DestructFunctor_T = MemoryDestructor<T>>
class nitf::Object< T, DestructFunctor_T >

This class keeps a pointer to an underlying C object The Object class does not destroy or clone any memory. The sole purpose is to act as a non-invasive wrapper on top of objects internal to the NITF C core.

Definition at line 104 of file Object.hpp.

template<typename T, typename DestructFunctor_T = MemoryDestructor<T>>
std::string nitf::Object< T, DestructFunctor_T >::getObjectID (  )  const [inline]

Returns an ID that represents this particular object. Currently, the ID is the stringized memory address of the underlying memory.

This *could* be used for equality purposes, however be warned, because as objects die, etc. the memory addresses will be reused.

template<typename T, typename DestructFunctor_T = MemoryDestructor<T>>
void nitf::Object< T, DestructFunctor_T >::setManaged ( bool  flag  )  [inline]

Set the management of the underlying memory

Parameters:
flag if flag is true, the underlying library will adopt and manage the memory if flag is false, the memory can be freed when refcount == 0
